title: 16-cell
summary: In geometry, the 16-cell is the regular convex 4-polytope (four-dimensional analogue of a Platonic solid) with Schläfli symbol {3,3,4}. It is one of the six regular convex 4-polytopes first described by the Swiss mathematician Ludwig Schläfli in the mid-19th century.[1] It is also called C16, hexadecachoron,[2] or hexdecahedroid [sic?] .[3]
